utterances.speaker: HANNITY

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.sentences: I love this country, and I want to have real elections where we debate ideas, not go through this process.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That's scary. Take a break. We'll come back. By the way, when we come back, two people personally impacted by Mueller's partisan witch hunt, as we continue, and what will unfold in the days and weeks ahead. Straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: A Fox News Alert. Police now giving an update on that mass shooting at Virginia Beach. Let's listen in.

utterances.speaker: GOV. RALPH NORTHAM, D-VA
utterances.sentences: Good evening. This is a horrific day for the Commonwealth of Virginia. Our hearts ache over the senseless violence that has been inflicted upon the Virginia Beach community today. My deepest condolences and prayers go to the families of those who left home this morning and will not return tonight. They were all someone's child, and many were someone's parent. They were heading into the summer weekend. That they should be taken in this manner is the worst kind of tragedy. Their families are facing painful loss and grief. They each leave a hole in a family, in their neighborhood, in this community, and in our commonwealth. We mourn with their loved ones, but sympathy doesn't fill that hole. We must take care of these families. These horrific tragedies test our souls. Grief doesn't pass quickly. It lasts far beyond these coming days, and these families will need support in the months and years to come. I'm also praying for those who were injured in this tragedy and hoping for their full recovery. Along with the pain of their own injuries, they face the loss of their co-workers and their friends. I want to commend the local and state law enforcement officers, the first responders, the medical teams, and all others who acted swiftly to respond to this situation. Their actions likely saved lives. And they have experienced scenes and injuries no one should ever have to face. My thoughts continue to be with the victims and their families. To them and to the City of Virginia Beach, I offer the full support of the Commonwealth of Virginia. Tonight, we are all about Virginia Beach. I'd now like to turn the podium over to our Mayor of Virginia Beach, Mayor Dyer.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR BOBBY DYER, VIRGINIA BEACH, VIRGINIA
utterances.sentences: Today is Virginia Beach's darkest hour. A senseless crime happened and imposed tremendous grief upon the people of Virginia Beach, the commonwealth and this country. When we get through the shock of it all and we get through the details that we must go through over the next day or two, I believe that our community, Virginia Beach, along with our neighbors and our other cities in Hampton Roads and our commonwealth and our country, we'll be there for not only the families, because that's when they're going to need us going forward, but we're going to show that Virginia Beach is a city of resolve and dedication. And we are going to be there for all the families, the friends and our community in a big way. And with that, I thank you, and I would like to turn this over to Chief Cervera for an update.

utterances.speaker: JAMES CERVERA, VIRGINIA BEACH POLICE CHIEF
utterances.sentences: As I said earlier this evening, as we are able to gather more information, we will give that information out. So this is the additional information that I have at this time. Again, it will probably change a little and it may increase as we move forward, as we're investigating this case. Right now, we have a team of investigators, detectives from the City of Virginia Beach being assisted by forensic technicians from the FBI and the state police in processing this most horrific scene. We're in the process of identifying victims and making notification to their families. I can tell you that we do have an additional victim to report. We now have 12. One victim succumbed to the injuries on the way to the hospital. We also have four additional victims being treated at area hospitals, and we have reports that others may have self-transported. So, as we get more information on that, we will begin to release it. Our process is always to notify family members prior to releasing names. We do know who the suspect is. We have not been successful in notifying certain family members. Once we are able to do that, we will release his name once. We're going to mention his name once. And then he will be forever referred to as the suspect because our focus now is the dignity and respect to the victims in this case and to their families. I can tell you that when the initial call came out of an active shoot in building two. Building number two in our city houses information technology, planning, public works and public utilities, plus a printing operation. This building has a potential of having over 400 city workers at one time or other in the building. When the original call came out, immediately four officers responded. Two were seasoned veteran supervisors from the Detective Bureau and we have two K-9 handlers who were assigned to our special operations unit. They immediately made entry into the building. Due to the sound of gunfire, they were able to locate the floor on which the suspect was committing his crimes. They immediately engaged with the suspect. And I can tell you that it was a long gun battle between those four officers and that suspect. We recovered a .45 caliber handgun with multiple extended magazines that were emptied at the time. The suspect was reloading extended magazines in that handgun, firing at victims throughout the building and at our officers. I want you to know that during this gun battle, basically the officers stopped this individual from committing more crimes in that building. When the suspect went down due to his injuries, our officers then immediately rendered first aid, as they were removing him from the building to the waiting EMS personnel. I need to say that a second time. Even though he was involved in a long-term moving gun battle with these officers, when he went down, they did what cops do and they rendered first aid to this individual. He succumbed to his wound. We have found victims on all three floors of the building as well as one victim who was outside in a vehicle. Right now, as many as 90 people have sought support from the Family Assistance Center. And again, we are in the process. Our goal now is to identify everyone in that building as quick as we can, so we can make the proper notifications to the families of those victims. Do we have any questions?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, you were saying outside. What was the relation to the victim outside? I mean, not the relation, but what did you say with a vehicle? I just want to--

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: An individual was in his vehicle when the suspect shot him.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, there were reports that this was a disgruntled employee. Had he been recently fired or were there any indications of any workplace trouble?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: I have no information at this time as to the background of the individual other than he's a city employee. Again, as we work through all of this, we'd be able to give more information out later.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He was current up until the shooting?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, I want to make sure I understand what you're saying. So he started shooting victims outside before entering the building?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: There was one victim outside. He entered the building. He was armed with a .45 caliber handgun that had a suppressor on it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can you tell us more about the extended magazine?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can you tell us more about the magazines?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: They were extended magazines. In other words, they have more ammunition than a regular magazine.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) Chief, in terms of the numbers, 12 people were killed and then the gunman was the 13th person that was killed or is that-

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: We have 12 victims--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Victims.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: --and a deceased suspect.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, were any of the victims targeted or was all of this random?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: At this time, I can't comment on that as we work through the investigation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you know if all victims were city employees?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: I cannot give you that because we are in the process of identifying the victims.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The numbers have changed a little bit. I just want to make sure we're straight with the number of victims who were taken to hospitals. Can we just get the sum total of what that number is now?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, I originally reported we had 11 victims.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. 11 victims.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: So we have an additional. One victim did not succumb to the wounds on the way to the hospital or at the hospital. And I am told that we have four others at the hospital right now going through surgeries.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So my math brings that to nine--

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, your math would say that we have 12 deceased.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. I (inaudible). So I apologize. I just don't want to make an error, but before you had said that there were six injured?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Injured.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: I did. And again, that was the information that I had at that time. It's been updated.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So now it's 10 injured?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: We have 12 deceased--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Two of the six injured--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Succumbed.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: Right. We have 12 deceased and we have four who were injured.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Who are currently--

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: --going through - yes, going through surgeries.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, have police had the opportunity to search the shooter's home? Had it found anything that's been of interest like additional weapons?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: We're in a process of continuing our investigation at this time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Were any other weapons found at the scene there? Reports said there was a rifle there as well.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: We're in the process of continuing - that's the best I'm going to be able to tell you at this moment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, can you elaborate more on the extensive gun battle between the officers and the shooter?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: I could tell you that there were numerous shots fired by the individual. Shots were fired from various places down the hallway at the officers, at one time returned. Basically, there are - the ammunition that they had. So when we talk about this kind of a situation, and many times when we talk about an officer involved in shooting situation, it may be minimal rounds by the suspect and by the police officers. This was well beyond that. This was a long time - the best I could describe it there was a long-term gun battle for the police officers.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can you put into--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The timeline how long--?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: I can't - I can't give you seconds and minutes because we don't - we don't have a stopwatch when we were engaged in this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you know the time that the suspect is dead?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you know what time the suspect died?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: Shortly after we entered the building and confronted him. So the call came out right after 4 p.m. So it'd be somewhere after that. We don't have the exact time right now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Can you tell us about security around these government buildings, how many police that are normally there? And are people allowed to enter these buildings with weapons?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: The individual in question is an employee. He has access to the building. He came in with a weapon today.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So he would not have been checked or--?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: No, he would not have been.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, was any officers injured?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: One officer did sustain a wound during the gun battle. Fortunately, his bulletproof vest basically saved his life. And we did - he was seen - he was tended to at the scene. But then we then brought him to the hospital afterwards to make sure that everything is OK with the officer.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, when you say suppressor, is that a silencer or is that the same thing or--?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: It's a suppressor - it's a sound suppressor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Was the gun recovered legally obtained?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: We're working through ATF at this time. It's part of our investigation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And police - has your department recently - I know in the past you have prepared for a scenario like this. I mean, how recently was the last time you prepared for this?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: We train continuously. We train not only as first responders for police, but we train with fire and we train with our EMS personnel because we know that when you have a major scene like this, you're going to need all first responders into that particular area. So we do train extensively, both on what we call table-top exercises as well as on all hands-on exercise in a building. So I could tell you that we do train extensively. And how many weeks or months prior, I can't give you the exact number. But our officers and our EMS personnel and our fire personnel are highly qualified, unfortunately, in a situation of an active shooter case.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, there were - of the four officers who entered, two were detectives and two were members of the K-9?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: The K-9, that's correct.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.sentences: OK. Thank you. Just one final thing. And I've said it before and you heard the Governor and the Mayor speak of it. We have numerous victims and we have numerous families. Let's make sure that we keep their dignity and their respect as the number one piece of news that we're going to give out, and I know that our local media always abides by, because their lives are changed forever. The folks who work in that building, their lives have changed. I have a number of officers right now-- HANNITY (ph): Stay with us for continuing coverage of the shooting. We'll have live updates throughout the night. "The Ingraham Angle" starts now. Content and Programming Copyright 2019 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. We've uncovered, yes, the biggest abuse of power, corruption scandal in modern political history, maybe in all of our history. So, tonight for you, we have a special show. We have brought in together the all-star ensemble cast, those that have every step of the way been helping America get to the truth and exposing the spying scandal, this Russian conspiracy theory since the start. So, tonight, for the full hour, we're going to break it all down. We're going to do what we do night after night. We're going to stick to the facts and the truth. We're going to be honest, and when every one else, the 99 percent of liars that push hoax and conspiracy theories, the media mob, as they continue to be wrong, a rigged investigation into Hillary Clinton to save their favorite candidate, the dirty Russian dossier, FISA abuse fraud, literally, purposely misleading, committing a fraud on a court on multiple occasions, using spies and informants to deep state efforts to undermine a president-elected by you, the American people, after they first tried to steal an election. Tonight, we shine a spotlight on all of this and tonight, we're taking it apart piece by piece, because we are only days away from the release now that the classification has occurred of major documents that will all expose the real election scandal, the real efforts to spy on the Trump campaign, FISA applications, 302s, Gang of Eight intel material, exculpatory material. As I said, an avalanche is coming. The cascading down with truth for the American people. There's no stopping it now. It's not a matter of if. It is when this all becomes public, so the gig is up. For the hate-Trump media mob, their Democratic allies, they've been pushing lie after lie after lie for 2.5 years ago. And also remember this which is really important, because how this all started, a phony investigation, it all started because Hillary Clinton should win 100 million to zero. And, by the way, if you voted for Donald Trump, you are a smelly Walmart voter. I like Walmart. And, by the way, you're an irredeemable deplorable that clings to your god, your guns, your bible and religion. That's what the Democratic Party thinks of us. A massive amount of top secret classified material was found on her unsecured private server in a mom and pop bathroom closet called and managed by Platte River Networks. utterances.speaker: MATT SCHLAPP, AMERICAN CONSERVATIVE UNION CHAIR
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's right. You take a step back from President Trump. And I remember serving in the Bush administration, when a lot of these extra powers, I know Mark Levin and others are writing about presidents abuse their powers. But the presidency got extra powers. Why? To go after terrorists. And I literally remember sitting in a conference room in the White House turning to lawyers who I still respect to this day and saying, doesn't it scare all of us that the government is going to have this expanded power that could look into almost anything it wanted, and if people in Congress don't ask the right questions, they could get away with that? And doesn't that scare people? And when I was told over and over again by these lawyers, don't worry, there are people in place, I wonder who they were, that have the best interest of the country, they will always safeguard these programs and we will make sure people of sterling character get to make the final decision. And so, going back to what you said about Obama, Biden, Lynch, James Comey who I have a distinction of refusing his political check for his first job in the Bush administration. What did the AG said? It just didn't pan out, or it just wasn't making sense, it didn't jive. The point is, n all this is that, take a step back from President Trump who has been so maligned. This will happen again if we don't stop it.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The scary thing is we might not be looking at the people we need to be looking at. My government is looking at me, I'm OK, I know they will respect the constitutional rights of all Americans, just like there's process if you are on a call with a foreigner, you're identified as an American, you're not supposed to be unmasked, which happened at a massive level. Pam, you have these awesome powers. As the attorney general, you had the ability and got warrants against people. Then you see what we are discussing here. Put it together how profound that is and how dangerous?

utterances.speaker: PAM BONDI, R-FORMER FLORIDA ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterances.utterance: Sean, it's not power; it's responsibility. When you take an office like it's about responsibility. When you see it as power like all of these corrupt people have, that's when you're in trouble. And the most frightening thing to me is they use their responsibility as power, and anyone who got in the way was collateral damage to get to the end of what they wanted to do. And I've warned people in this room. I believe they were probably illegally taped. They would do anything--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I've been warned. I'm still here. Geraldo promised me a cake with a file. He did.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: They would do anything they could do to take out our President. And all of these great people in this room and you did not let it happen. And people - we're not scared, these people, to come up to speak the truth and fight against it. And what Matt just said, we've got to keep doing that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, what I - we've become such dear friends. I'm going to celebrate your 50th year in broadcasting in amazing ways that you have no idea. But here's the thing. You've always said you never understood, you want Donald Trump and the country to succeed. Now, this has gone on for 2.5 years of his Presidency and still he has an incredible record on the economy, on promises he made.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.utterance: We get one President at a time. And I think that all Americans should unite behind the President. But I want to back up just one second to what happened this morning. William Barr's interview on CBS was kind of under-stated and matter of fact. But the implication of what he said is so profound. What have we experienced? We have experienced some of the most powerful people in our government, Comey, Clapper, Brennan, using the power of the United States government to prove that the candidate Trump, President-Elect Trump, President Trump was a traitor, was a spy for the Russians, was a person whose loyalty lay outside the constitution, outside of the United States, and had sold his soul to the neo-communist devil. I think that this is so atrocious that that would be their motivating impulse, shows how distorted their hatred of the President--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, if Donald Trump cured cancer and gave every American $10 million and even adopted their insane New Green Deal agenda, they'd still hate him. And - look, you've been in this business for a long time. Truth matters. Facts matter. And the American people have been - 99 percent of the media went with the lies, the conspiracy theories. And they're not admitting they are wrong that they thought for a few hours yesterday Mueller gave them what they wanted again until Mueller had to be corrected and put out a joint statement with the Attorney General saying, oops, ah, I was wrong.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's not just those people. It is also - look at history. Wouldn't history have been so profoundly different if William Barr had been the initial pick to be the Attorney General of the United States by Donald Trump? I'm--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're going to - you're giving Joe a heart attack. He's - yes, it would've been. We'll take a break. We'll come back. Deep state actors, they are defiant. They're all about to be exposed. Who are they? What is going to happen next? We'll explain, as this edition of HANNITY continues.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Welcome back to Hannity: Act Two, the Deep State's Day of Reckoning. Now, as the walls begin to close in on all of these deep state actors who tried to undermine Donald Trump's Presidency, well, former top intel brash John Brennan, James Comey, Clapper, among so many others, they are scrambling now to justify their dubious actions, rewrite history, and are actually now creating a circular firing squad. And we're noticing they're turning on each other, which is probably a good sign. We continue with our live panel here. I always do this at the end. We kind of know the story. This audience has stayed with us. So I want to kind of move a little bit because I don't want to rush the end part here. Tom Fitton, you keep putting in FOIA request after FOIA request. Who is in trouble? How badly? And will it happen? That's the question I get asked by my audience the most.

utterances.speaker: TOM FITTON, JUDICIAL WATCH PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: Well, something ought to happen. I think the President is a crime victim. Carter Page obviously is a crime victim. And you had top officials, I think it can be strongly suggested, misused their office for political purposes, mishandled classified information to target someone over politics, otherwise misuse government resources to target and spy on people over politics. And the President is the number one victim. And who benefitted the most from that? Hillary Clinton and her co- conspirators in the Obama administration who avoided the consequences of her email misconduct. In many ways, the targeting of Trump on Russia froze the Justice Department from engaging in full accountability and cleaning up over the Hillary mess. And that's over--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --over to you.

utterances.speaker: FITTON
utterances.utterance: Mrs. Clinton has as much to worry about as some of these deep state actors, in my view.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Doug, you are unique. You're a Democrat. You're a Clinton Democrat. Sorry to hear that.

utterances.speaker: DOUG SCHOEN, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --and you see a disaster politically coming for the Democratic Party.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: Right. I see, Sean, that the Democrats are moving so far left as a party. The Ocasio-Cortez, Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren remain (ph). My party is now at its mess level, getting behind Joe Biden. The left is going to try to undermine him and make an election that is likely to be very competitive, less so. One other word, Sean--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: By the way, I'll make a statement. I already have a dossier on creepy, crazy, sleepy Uncle Joe.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: But let's have a real election rather than what everyone here, in the most compelling way, has described. Let me say one more thing. As a partisan Democrat, I respect everyone here. Many of these people are my good friends. What I believe as a Democrat is we need to know the facts of what happened. I'm glad we had a Mueller report. I'm glad we've been able to assess it. Let's do the same thing as Joe Digenova said on the Democratic side because what the FBI allegedly did, what the Clinton campaign allegedly did, what Comey, what Strzok, what Page did, this needs to be aired completely.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: I say this not as a partisan Democrat--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You say it as somebody who loves this country.

utterances.speaker: SCHOEN
utterances.utterance: I love this country, and I want to have real elections where we debate ideas, not go through this process.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Now I want to begin this lightning round. Who is in trouble? Do you see indictments and convictions? Everybody that I - we've been doing this for over two years. When is it coming out? When is it happening? We've got declassification. We have an AG investigation. Michael Horowitz and Huber, Durham in Boston now. Where are we going, Joe? Where is this going to end?

utterances.speaker: JOE DIGENOVA, FORMER U.S. ATTORNEY FOR THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
utterances.utterance: What we need is a real federal investigation of the former federal investigators.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Wow!

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: Bill Barr is going to do that. Will there be convictions? I don't know. Jury trials are river boat gamble. It doesn't matter. What we need is an expose of the entire process. What Geraldo Rivera said is so scary, so frightening that any American who doesn't think we need to get to the bottom of that is out of his or her mind.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We lose the country?

utterances.speaker: DIGENOVA
utterances.utterance: This is so seminal to what we are as a country. We have to know what Brennan, Clapper, Comey, all of these people did. If we don't find this out, if Barr doesn't get to the bottom of this, the body politic of this country is going to be just rent asunder.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Tipping point for the country?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Oh, of course, because we have to stop it now. If we don't, it will happen again. These - this just doesn't start. As I said before, this has been going on.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That's scary. Take a break. We'll come back. By the way, when we come back, two people personally impacted by Mueller's partisan witch hunt, as we continue, and what will unfold in the days and weeks ahead. Straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: A Fox News Alert. Police now giving an update on that mass shooting at Virginia Beach. Let's listen in.

utterances.speaker: GOV. RALPH NORTHAM, D-VA
utterances.utterance: Good evening. This is a horrific day for the Commonwealth of Virginia. Our hearts ache over the senseless violence that has been inflicted upon the Virginia Beach community today. My deepest condolences and prayers go to the families of those who left home this morning and will not return tonight. They were all someone's child, and many were someone's parent. They were heading into the summer weekend. That they should be taken in this manner is the worst kind of tragedy. Their families are facing painful loss and grief. They each leave a hole in a family, in their neighborhood, in this community, and in our commonwealth. We mourn with their loved ones, but sympathy doesn't fill that hole. We must take care of these families. These horrific tragedies test our souls. Grief doesn't pass quickly. It lasts far beyond these coming days, and these families will need support in the months and years to come. I'm also praying for those who were injured in this tragedy and hoping for their full recovery. Along with the pain of their own injuries, they face the loss of their co-workers and their friends. I want to commend the local and state law enforcement officers, the first responders, the medical teams, and all others who acted swiftly to respond to this situation. Their actions likely saved lives. And they have experienced scenes and injuries no one should ever have to face. My thoughts continue to be with the victims and their families. To them and to the City of Virginia Beach, I offer the full support of the Commonwealth of Virginia. Tonight, we are all about Virginia Beach. I'd now like to turn the podium over to our Mayor of Virginia Beach, Mayor Dyer.

utterances.speaker: MAYOR BOBBY DYER, VIRGINIA BEACH, VIRGINIA
utterances.utterance: Today is Virginia Beach's darkest hour. A senseless crime happened and imposed tremendous grief upon the people of Virginia Beach, the commonwealth and this country. When we get through the shock of it all and we get through the details that we must go through over the next day or two, I believe that our community, Virginia Beach, along with our neighbors and our other cities in Hampton Roads and our commonwealth and our country, we'll be there for not only the families, because that's when they're going to need us going forward, but we're going to show that Virginia Beach is a city of resolve and dedication. And we are going to be there for all the families, the friends and our community in a big way. And with that, I thank you, and I would like to turn this over to Chief Cervera for an update.

utterances.speaker: JAMES CERVERA, VIRGINIA BEACH POLICE CHIEF
utterances.utterance: As I said earlier this evening, as we are able to gather more information, we will give that information out. So this is the additional information that I have at this time. Again, it will probably change a little and it may increase as we move forward, as we're investigating this case. Right now, we have a team of investigators, detectives from the City of Virginia Beach being assisted by forensic technicians from the FBI and the state police in processing this most horrific scene. We're in the process of identifying victims and making notification to their families. I can tell you that we do have an additional victim to report. We now have 12. One victim succumbed to the injuries on the way to the hospital. We also have four additional victims being treated at area hospitals, and we have reports that others may have self-transported. So, as we get more information on that, we will begin to release it. Our process is always to notify family members prior to releasing names. We do know who the suspect is. We have not been successful in notifying certain family members. Once we are able to do that, we will release his name once. We're going to mention his name once. And then he will be forever referred to as the suspect because our focus now is the dignity and respect to the victims in this case and to their families. I can tell you that when the initial call came out of an active shoot in building two. Building number two in our city houses information technology, planning, public works and public utilities, plus a printing operation. This building has a potential of having over 400 city workers at one time or other in the building. When the original call came out, immediately four officers responded. Two were seasoned veteran supervisors from the Detective Bureau and we have two K-9 handlers who were assigned to our special operations unit. They immediately made entry into the building. Due to the sound of gunfire, they were able to locate the floor on which the suspect was committing his crimes. They immediately engaged with the suspect. And I can tell you that it was a long gun battle between those four officers and that suspect. We recovered a .45 caliber handgun with multiple extended magazines that were emptied at the time. The suspect was reloading extended magazines in that handgun, firing at victims throughout the building and at our officers. I want you to know that during this gun battle, basically the officers stopped this individual from committing more crimes in that building. When the suspect went down due to his injuries, our officers then immediately rendered first aid, as they were removing him from the building to the waiting EMS personnel. I need to say that a second time. Even though he was involved in a long-term moving gun battle with these officers, when he went down, they did what cops do and they rendered first aid to this individual. He succumbed to his wound. We have found victims on all three floors of the building as well as one victim who was outside in a vehicle. Right now, as many as 90 people have sought support from the Family Assistance Center. And again, we are in the process. Our goal now is to identify everyone in that building as quick as we can, so we can make the proper notifications to the families of those victims. Do we have any questions?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, you were saying outside. What was the relation to the victim outside? I mean, not the relation, but what did you say with a vehicle? I just want to--

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: An individual was in his vehicle when the suspect shot him.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, there were reports that this was a disgruntled employee. Had he been recently fired or were there any indications of any workplace trouble?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: I have no information at this time as to the background of the individual other than he's a city employee. Again, as we work through all of this, we'd be able to give more information out later.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: He was current up until the shooting?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, I want to make sure I understand what you're saying. So he started shooting victims outside before entering the building?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: There was one victim outside. He entered the building. He was armed with a .45 caliber handgun that had a suppressor on it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Can you tell us more about the extended magazine?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Can you tell us more about the magazines?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: They were extended magazines. In other words, they have more ammunition than a regular magazine.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: (Inaudible) Chief, in terms of the numbers, 12 people were killed and then the gunman was the 13th person that was killed or is that-

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: We have 12 victims--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Victims.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: --and a deceased suspect.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Thank you, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, were any of the victims targeted or was all of this random?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: At this time, I can't comment on that as we work through the investigation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Do you know if all victims were city employees?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: I cannot give you that because we are in the process of identifying the victims.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The numbers have changed a little bit. I just want to make sure we're straight with the number of victims who were taken to hospitals. Can we just get the sum total of what that number is now?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I originally reported we had 11 victims.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes, sir. 11 victims.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: So we have an additional. One victim did not succumb to the wounds on the way to the hospital or at the hospital. And I am told that we have four others at the hospital right now going through surgeries.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: So my math brings that to nine--

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, your math would say that we have 12 deceased.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes, sir. I (inaudible). So I apologize. I just don't want to make an error, but before you had said that there were six injured?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Injured.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: I did. And again, that was the information that I had at that time. It's been updated.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: So now it's 10 injured?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: We have 12 deceased--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Two of the six injured--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Succumbed.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: Right. We have 12 deceased and we have four who were injured.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Who are currently--

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: --going through - yes, going through surgeries.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, have police had the opportunity to search the shooter's home? Had it found anything that's been of interest like additional weapons?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: We're in a process of continuing our investigation at this time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Were any other weapons found at the scene there? Reports said there was a rifle there as well.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: We're in the process of continuing - that's the best I'm going to be able to tell you at this moment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, can you elaborate more on the extensive gun battle between the officers and the shooter?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: I could tell you that there were numerous shots fired by the individual. Shots were fired from various places down the hallway at the officers, at one time returned. Basically, there are - the ammunition that they had. So when we talk about this kind of a situation, and many times when we talk about an officer involved in shooting situation, it may be minimal rounds by the suspect and by the police officers. This was well beyond that. This was a long time - the best I could describe it there was a long-term gun battle for the police officers.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Can you put into--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The timeline how long--?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: I can't - I can't give you seconds and minutes because we don't - we don't have a stopwatch when we were engaged in this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Do you know the time that the suspect is dead?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Do you know what time the suspect died?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: Shortly after we entered the building and confronted him. So the call came out right after 4 p.m. So it'd be somewhere after that. We don't have the exact time right now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief--

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Can you tell us about security around these government buildings, how many police that are normally there? And are people allowed to enter these buildings with weapons?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: The individual in question is an employee. He has access to the building. He came in with a weapon today.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: So he would not have been checked or--?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: No, he would not have been.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, was any officers injured?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: One officer did sustain a wound during the gun battle. Fortunately, his bulletproof vest basically saved his life. And we did - he was seen - he was tended to at the scene. But then we then brought him to the hospital afterwards to make sure that everything is OK with the officer.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, when you say suppressor, is that a silencer or is that the same thing or--?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: It's a suppressor - it's a sound suppressor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Was the gun recovered legally obtained?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: We're working through ATF at this time. It's part of our investigation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: And police - has your department recently - I know in the past you have prepared for a scenario like this. I mean, how recently was the last time you prepared for this?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: We train continuously. We train not only as first responders for police, but we train with fire and we train with our EMS personnel because we know that when you have a major scene like this, you're going to need all first responders into that particular area. So we do train extensively, both on what we call table-top exercises as well as on all hands-on exercise in a building. So I could tell you that we do train extensively. And how many weeks or months prior, I can't give you the exact number. But our officers and our EMS personnel and our fire personnel are highly qualified, unfortunately, in a situation of an active shooter case.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Chief, there were - of the four officers who entered, two were detectives and two were members of the K-9?

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: The K-9, that's correct.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: CERVERA
utterances.utterance: OK. Thank you. Just one final thing. And I've said it before and you heard the Governor and the Mayor speak of it. We have numerous victims and we have numerous families. Let's make sure that we keep their dignity and their respect as the number one piece of news that we're going to give out, and I know that our local media always abides by, because their lives are changed forever. The folks who work in that building, their lives have changed. I have a number of officers right now--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY (ph)
utterances.utterance: Stay with us for continuing coverage of the shooting. We'll have live updates throughout the night. "The Ingraham Angle" starts now.
